This synthesis feels like a more robust way of thinking—applying my core interests to novel inputs, rather than being derailed by them. The V-formation seems like the strongest, most accessible starting point. I'll propose we discuss how a flock of ducks can be seen as a complex system and how their flight patterns are an emergent property that benefits the group, even though no single duck designs the formation.
